title: Which is more softer sodium or potassium? - Quora

response.answer_text: Note that both metals readily demonstrate metallic properties, i.e. malleability…the ability to be rolled out into a sheet…and in fact you can roll out these metals as you would pastry (in fact better than pastry because the metallic films tend not to break)…and ductility, the ability to be drawn out into a wire. And some labs have a sodium press, i.e. a LARGE thread leading to a die with a small whole at the end. You screw down the thread, and from the other end a thin wire of sodium emerges… Anyway, in answer to your question (finally!), potassium is SOFTER than sodium..
Sodium is softer but potassium is more softer then sodium
